# statgenGxE

[![](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/statgenGxE)](https://www.r-pkg.org/pkg/statgenGxE)
[![CRAN RStudio mirror
downloads](https://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/statgenGxE)](https://www.r-pkg.org/pkg/statgenGxE)
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/Biometris/statgenGxE/actions/workflows/check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/Biometris/statgenGxE/actions/workflows/check.yaml)
[![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/Biometris/statgenGxE/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)](https://app.codecov.io/gh/Biometris/statgenGxE)

**statgenGxE** is an R package providing functions for Genotype by
Environment (GxE) analysis for data of plant breeding experiments.

The following types of analysis can be done using statgenGxE:

- Mixed model analysis of GxE table of means
- Finlay-Wilkinson Analysis
- AMMI Analysis
- GGE Analysis
- Identifying mega environments
- Stability measures
- Modeling of heterogeneity of genetic variances and correlations

statgenGxE has extensive options for summarizing and visualizing the
results of the analyses. For a full overview of all options it is best
to read the
[**vignette**](https://biometris.github.io/statgenGxE/articles/statgenGxE.html)

## Installation

- Install from CRAN:

``` r
install.packages("statgenGxE")
```

- Install latest development version from GitHub (requires
  [remotes](https://github.com/r-lib/remotes) package):

``` r
remotes::install_github("Biometris/statgenGxE", ref = "develop", dependencies = TRUE)
```

# Package index

## Mixed model analysis of GxE table of means

- [`gxeVarComp()`](gxeVarComp.md) : Mixed model analysis of GxE table of
  means
- [`plot(`*`<varComp>`*`)`](plot.varComp.md) : Plot function for class
  varComp
- [`predict(`*`<varComp>`*`)`](predict.varComp.md) : Predictions based
  on a fitted varComp model.
- [`vc()`](vc.md) : Extract variance components
- [`herit()`](herit.md) : Calculate heritability
- [`CRDR()`](CRDR.md) : Calculate the correlated response to selection
- [`correlations()`](correlations.md) : Compute different types of
  correlations.
- [`diagnostics()`](diagnostics.md) : Get diagnostics for an object of
  class varComp

## Finlay-Wilkinson

- [`gxeFw()`](gxeFw.md) : Finlay-Wilkinson analysis
- [`plot(`*`<FW>`*`)`](plot.FW.md) : Plot function for class FW
- [`report(`*`<FW>`*`)`](report.FW.md) : Report method for class FW
- [`fitted(`*`<FW>`*`)`](fitted.FW.md) : Extract fitted values.
- [`residuals(`*`<FW>`*`)`](residuals.FW.md) : Extract residuals.

## AMMI

- [`gxeAmmi()`](gxeAmmi.md) : AMMI analysis
- [`plot(`*`<AMMI>`*`)`](plot.AMMI.md) : Plot function for class AMMI
- [`report(`*`<AMMI>`*`)`](report.AMMI.md) : Report method for class
  AMMI
- [`fitted(`*`<AMMI>`*`)`](fitted.AMMI.md) : Extract fitted values.
- [`residuals(`*`<AMMI>`*`)`](residuals.AMMI.md) : Extract residuals.

## GGE

- [`gxeGGE()`](gxeGGE.md) : GGE analysis

## Identifying mega environments

- [`gxeMegaEnv()`](gxeMegaEnv.md) : Form mega environments based on
  fitted values from an AMMI model
- [`plot(`*`<megaEnv>`*`)`](plot.megaEnv.md) : Plot function for class
  megaEnv
- [`predict(`*`<megaEnv>`*`)`](predict.megaEnv.md) : Compute BLUPS based
  on a set of mega environments

## Stability measures

- [`gxeStability()`](gxeStability.md) : Calculate stability coefficients
  for genotype-by-environment data
- [`plot(`*`<stability>`*`)`](plot.stability.md) : Plot function for
  class stability
- [`report(`*`<stability>`*`)`](report.stability.md) : Report method for
  class stability

## Modeling of heterogeneity of genetic variances and correlations

- [`gxeVarCov()`](gxeVarCov.md) : Selects the best variance-covariance
  model for a set of trials
- [`plot(`*`<varCov>`*`)`](plot.varCov.md) : Plot function for class
  varCov
- [`report(`*`<varCov>`*`)`](report.varCov.md) : Report method for class
  varCov
- [`fitted(`*`<varCov>`*`)`](fitted.varCov.md) : Extract fitted values.
- [`residuals(`*`<varCov>`*`)`](residuals.varCov.md) : Extract
  residuals.

## Example data

- [`dropsPheno`](dropsPheno.md) : DROPS data set
- [`TDMaize`](TDMaize.md) : Field data for a maize experiment in
  Tlaltizapan, Mexico

## Internal helper functions

- [`multMissing()`](multMissing.md) : Estimate missing values in
  multivariate data

# Articles

### Vignettes

This vignette provides a full description of the statgenGxE package
including a fully worked example.

- [Genotype by Environment analysis using statgenGxE](statgenGxE.md):
